questions.title: Hello World
questions.description: Write a program that prints 'Hello, World!' to the console.
questions.prompt: Create a program that outputs exactly 'Hello, World!'

questions.title: Sum of Numbers
questions.description: Write a program that takes two numbers as input and prints their sum.
questions.prompt: Read two integers from input and print their sum

solutions.python3:
a = int(input())
b = int(input())
print(a + b)

questions.title: Count Digits
questions.description: Write a program that counts the number of digits in a given number.
questions.prompt: Read an integer and print the count of digits in it

questions.title: Check Even or Odd
questions.description: Write a program that determines if a number is even or odd.
questions.prompt: Read a number and print 'Even' if it's even, 'Odd' if it's odd

questions.title: Factorial
questions.description: Write a program that calculates the factorial of a number.
questions.prompt: Read an integer n and print its factorial (n!)

solutions.python3:
n = int(input())
fact = 1
for i in range(1, n + 1):
    fact *= i
print(fact)

questions.title: Binary Tree Height
questions.description: Calculate the height of a binary tree. The height is the number of edges on the longest path from root to leaf.
questions.prompt: Implement a function to find the height of a binary tree using recursion

questions.title: Binary Tree Inorder Traversal
questions.description: Perform inorder traversal of a binary tree (left-root-right order).
questions.prompt: Traverse a binary tree in inorder and print the sequence

questions.title: Graph BFS Traversal
questions.description: Traverse a graph level by level using Breadth-First Search algorithm.
questions.prompt: Implement BFS to traverse graph starting from a given vertex

questions.title: Graph DFS Traversal
questions.description: Traverse a graph exploring as far as possible before backtracking using Depth-First Search.
questions.prompt: Implement DFS to traverse graph starting from a given vertex

questions.title: Fibonacci with Memoization
questions.description: Calculate the nth Fibonacci number efficiently using dynamic programming with memoization.
questions.prompt: Find nth Fibonacci number in O(n) time using DP

questions.title: Longest Common Subsequence
questions.description: Find the length of the longest common subsequence between two strings using dynamic programming.
questions.prompt: Calculate LCS length of two strings using 2D DP table

questions.title: Reverse Linked List
questions.description: Reverse a singly linked list in-place by changing node pointers.
questions.prompt: Reverse linked list using iterative approach with O(1) space

questions.title: Detect Cycle in Linked List
questions.description: Detect if a linked list contains a cycle using Floyd's cycle detection algorithm (slow and fast pointers).
questions.prompt: Use two pointers to detect cycle in O(1) space

questions.title: Valid Parentheses
questions.description: Check if a string has valid matching parentheses using a stack data structure.
questions.prompt: Validate brackets (), {}, [] using stack

questions.title: Min Stack
questions.description: Design a stack that supports push, pop, top, and retrieving minimum element in O(1) time.
questions.prompt: Implement stack with constant time getMin operation

questions.title: Implement Queue using Stacks
questions.description: Implement a FIFO queue using only two LIFO stacks.
questions.prompt: Create queue with enqueue, dequeue using two stacks

questions.title: Circular Queue
questions.description: Implement a fixed-size circular queue with efficient space utilization using array.
questions.prompt: Design circular queue with O(1) operations

questions.title: Kth Largest Element
questions.description: Find the kth largest element in an unsorted array using min heap or quick select.
questions.prompt: Find kth largest in O(n log k) using heap

questions.title: Merge K Sorted Lists
questions.description: Merge k sorted linked lists into one sorted list using min heap for efficiency.
questions.prompt: Merge multiple sorted lists in O(N log k) time

questions.title: Merge Sort
questions.description: Sort an array using merge sort algorithm with divide and conquer approach.
questions.prompt: Implement merge sort with O(n log n) time

questions.title: Quick Sort
questions.description: Sort an array using quick sort algorithm with partitioning and pivot selection.
questions.prompt: Implement quick sort with in-place partitioning

questions.title: Two Sum
questions.description: Find two numbers in an array that add up to a target sum using hash table for O(n) solution.
questions.prompt: Find indices of two numbers summing to target

questions.title: Group Anagrams
questions.description: Group anagrams together from a list of strings using hash table with sorted string keys.
questions.prompt: Group strings that are anagrams of each other

questions.title: Generate Permutations
questions.description: Generate all permutations of a given array using recursive backtracking algorithm.
questions.prompt: Find all permutations using backtracking

questions.title: N-Queens Problem
questions.description: Solve N-Queens puzzle by placing n queens on n×n chessboard so no two queens attack each other.
questions.prompt: Use backtracking with constraint checking

questions.title: Binary Search
questions.description: Search for a target element in a sorted array using binary search algorithm.
questions.prompt: Find target in sorted array with O(log n) time

questions.title: Find First and Last Position
questions.description: Find starting and ending position of target in sorted array with duplicates using modified binary search.
questions.prompt: Find both bounds in O(log n) using two binary searches

questions.title: Maximum Sum Subarray of Size K
questions.description: Find maximum sum of any contiguous subarray of size k using sliding window technique.
questions.prompt: Use sliding window for O(n) solution

questions.description: Find length of longest substring without repeating characters using sliding window with hash set.
questions.prompt: Use variable sliding window technique

questions.title: Container With Most Water
questions.description: Find maximum water container area using two pointer technique from both ends.
questions.prompt: Use two pointers to find max area in O(n)

questions.title: Three Sum
questions.description: Find all unique triplets that sum to zero using sorting and two pointers.
questions.prompt: Find triplets summing to zero in O(n²) time

questions.prompt: Build Trie data structure with O(m) operations

questions.prompt: Combine Trie with backtracking for efficient search

questions.description: Select maximum number of non-overlapping activities using greedy approach by sorting end times.
questions.prompt: Greedy activity selection in O(n log n)

questions.description: Build optimal Huffman tree for data compression using greedy algorithm with min heap.

questions.description: Count number of 1 bits in binary representation using bit manipulation techniques.
questions.prompt: Use Brian Kernighan's algorithm or bit operations

questions.description: Find element appearing once when all others appear twice using XOR properties.
questions.prompt: Use XOR for O(1) space solution

questions.description: Find maximum sum of contiguous subarray using Kadane's algorithm.
questions.prompt: Implement Kadane's algorithm for O(n) solution

questions.title: Count Inversions
questions.description: Count inversions in array using modified merge sort divide and conquer approach.
questions.prompt: Count inversions during merge sort in O(n log n)

questions.title: Union Find - Detect Cycle
questions.description: Detect cycle in undirected graph using Union Find (Disjoint Set Union) data structure.
questions.prompt: Use path compression and union by rank

questions.title: Number of Connected Components
questions.description: Count connected components in undirected graph using Union Find data structure.
questions.prompt: Track component count with union operations

questions.title: Spiral Matrix Traversal
questions.description: Traverse matrix in spiral order (clockwise from outside to inside) using boundary simulation.
questions.prompt: Maintain four boundaries and traverse in spiral

questions.description: Rotate n×n matrix 90 degrees clockwise in-place with O(1) extra space.

questions.prompt: Expand from each center for O(n²) solution
